# Ardo

> React-first Static Documentation Framework built on React 19, React Router 7, and Vite.

Ardo combines the developer experience of VitePress with the power of the React ecosystem. Write documentation in Markdown, use React components, and deploy as a static site.

- [What is Ardo?](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/guide/what-is-ardo): Overview, philosophy, and core features
- [Getting Started](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/guide/getting-started): Installation, setup, and project structure
- [Markdown Features](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/guide/markdown): Syntax highlighting, containers, code groups, and custom components
- [Frontmatter](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/guide/frontmatter): Page-level configuration via YAML frontmatter
- [Theme Configuration](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/guide/theme-config): Navigation, sidebar, footer, search, and social links
- [Custom Theme](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/guide/custom-theme): CSS variables, component overrides, runtime hooks, and full custom themes
- [TypeDoc Integration](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/guide/typedoc): Auto-generate API documentation from TypeScript source
- [Troubleshooting](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/guide/troubleshooting): Common issues and solutions
- [Deployment](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/guide/deployment): Deploy to GitHub Pages, Netlify, Vercel, and more
- [Full documentation as single file](https://sebastian-software.github.io/ardo/llms-full.txt): Complete documentation optimized for LLM consumption

## Package Exports

- `ardo/vite` — Vite plugin (`ardo()` function that returns all required plugins including React Router)
- `ardo/runtime` — React hooks (`useConfig`, `useThemeConfig`, `useSidebar`, `usePageData`, `useTOC`)
- `ardo/ui` — Pre-built UI components (Layout, Header, Sidebar, TOC, Footer, DocPage, HomePage, CodeBlock, Hero, Features, etc.)
- `ardo/ui/styles.css` — Default theme stylesheet
- `ardo/typedoc` — TypeDoc generation utilities (`generateApiDocs`)

## Quick Start

```bash
# Scaffold a new project (recommended)
pnpm create ardo@latest my-docs

# Or install manually
pnpm add ardo react react-dom react-router isbot
pnpm add -D typescript vite @types/react @types/react-dom
```

## Key Concepts

- Configuration via `vite.config.ts` using the `ardo()` plugin from `ardo/vite`
- All config (title, description, themeConfig) is passed directly to `ardo()`
- Content lives in `app/routes/` as MDX/MD files
- Uses React Router 7 for file-based routing and pre-rendering
- JSX-first architecture: theme components accept explicit props
- Supports both config-driven sidebar/nav and JSX composition
- Built-in full-text search via MiniSearch
- Dark mode via CSS custom properties
- TypeDoc integration for API reference generation

## Project Structure

```
my-docs/
├── app/
│   ├── routes/               # MDX/MD content and route files
│   │   ├── guide/*.mdx       # Documentation pages
│   │   └── home.tsx          # Home page
│   ├── root.tsx              # Root layout
│   ├── entry.client.tsx      # Client entry
│   └── entry.server.tsx      # Server entry
├── vite.config.ts            # Vite + Ardo configuration
├── react-router.config.ts    # React Router configuration
└── package.json
```
